title: Why is Lost Chapter allowed to be a staple in this game? Mana management needs to come back.

replies.body: Season 2 had Mana pots, case closed
Getting mana back over time being costly vs leveling up to get 20% mana constantly right till the end of laning phase while building a really strong offensive item with high CDR. Right.

Chapter's Mana restore is over time too, and it's only when you level up, as opposed to Mana pots being bought in bulk and used whenever you like.  

More importantly that was converted from the old Morello's component forbidden idol, which gave CDR and Mana regen.  At that point you were allowed to regain Mana and spam spells for less gold than chapter.  At least chapter does not give CDR and Morello only gives 20% CDR when you complete the item.
You can take my lost chapter when you remove all manaless champions from the game.

Most champs who are manaless are balanced around it. {{champion:266}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:238}} are all fine being manaless. The only problems I see are {{champion:157}} and {{champion:92}}

Mana management was never a real thing. Mana Manipulator was there in Vanilla League, then Cata was there which was basically Lost Chapter, exactly the same thing except it also gave health when you leveled up. They made Athenes and everyone started using that, then they reworked the passive on Rod and Cata making Lost Chapters. So I have no idea what era of League you played that had mana Management.

If you want to play a game with mana management, go play Dota 2.
Mana isn't meant to be an enormous constraint the entire game. Hell, the only mana exists at all is so that laning against poke champs doesn't feel like Urf.
